description: {"blocks":[{"key":"55a2c","text":"Immunofluorescent (IF) microscopy is a powerful tool used in cellular and molecular biology to monitor the subcellular localisation of proteins. By combining the advantages of immunostaining and confocal light microscope, IF microscopy can be used to assess the colocalization of two or more proteins within the cell. Here, we describe a method that can be used to verify the correct localisation of endogenously expressed TMEM192, by assessing their colocalization with LAMP1 (a lysosomal marker) and ATPB1 (a mitochondrial marker). Furthermore, our data showed that the anti-TMEM192 antibody is compatible for immunofluorescence assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv9dv","text":"Incubate cells at   with diluted secondary antibodies for  . Do this in a humid chamber on a piece of Parafilm. Put a   drop of diluted antibodies on the parafilm. Carefully place coverslip on the droplet, with the side containing attached cells, facing inward, making contact with the droplet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":118,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"boa5m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"60","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75mhl","text":"Label microscope glass slides (preferably the one with frosted side) according to the primary antibody used. Take note of the emission wavelength of the probe on the secondary antibodies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"380kn","text":"Add a drop of VECTASHIELD antifading Mounting media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fu3v","text":"Mount cover slip (containing cells) on the glass slide, ensuring that the side containing the cells is facing inward, making contact with the oil. Allow to dry for  , ensuring slides are prevented from direct light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":164,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7mc7s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
